Dead.synopsis: We can speak to Gandrel if he dies - he'll hint at his mission to hunt Astarion on behalf of Maiden Fel. Separate options if it's Astarion himself speaking to him.

individual_metadata.synopsis: Male, middle-age or older.Gandrel is a monster hunter we encounter outside the Hag's lair. He's pleasant, cheerful, and a little eccentric - but shows his experience and expertise when warning us about the hag. He's affable and unassuming, but shows moments of steel when discussing his quarry (Astarion). A younger General Iroh from Avatar is a good reference - someone who makes you feel good about yourself just by conversing with you.
individual_metadata.how_to_trigger: Repro steps:1) To trigger Astarion's branch:1. Start the game2. Make sure Astarion's not in party3. SetGlobalOsirisFlag ORI_Astarion_Knows_Vampireness- goto -19.11, 1.99, 255.22. The swamp illusion check will trigger.4. Speak to Gandrel. He will eventually mention he's hunting someone (Astarion). Tell him you don't know who Astarion is. 5. After dialog ends, add Astarion into party6. Speak to Gandrel again.7. Astarion will make sarcastic remarks about the creature Gandrel is hunting. Choose to end the dialog peacefully and leave8. Talk to Gandrel again. This time choose to give up Astarion to him. 2) Meeting Gandrel after dealing with Hag:1. Meet the Hag, fight her and spare her life2. goto -27, 5, 241 3. Speak to Gandrel.

automatic_ordering.reasoning: There are two main branches in the data. One branch is triggered when Gandrel is encountered alive – this branch (shown by the second, unnamed session) includes several internal steps, for example, the Astarion branch where you first speak to Gandrel before adding Astarion to your party and then returning to speak with him again (with options such as peacefully ending the conversation or giving up Astarion to him), and a branch triggered after dealing with the Hag (where you fight her, spare her life, then speak to Gandrel). These internal orders imply that certain dialogue parts must occur after some prerequisites (for example, you must first speak to Gandrel before the follow‐up “give up Astarion” dialogue). In contrast, the “Dead” session is only available if Gandrel dies. Since the alive conversation branch and the “Dead” branch cannot occur in the same playthrough they are mutually exclusive. Therefore, we can set up ordering rules within the alive branch (one for the Astarion branch and one for the Hag branch) and an exclusivity rule between the “Dead” session and the alive dialogue branch.

predecessor: Initial dialogue with Gandrel (alive) via Astarion branch
order.successor: Follow-up dialogue where you give Astarion up to Gandrel

predecessor: Encounter with the Hag (fight and spare her life)
order.successor: Gandrel conversation after dealing with the Hag

Dead_23.speaker: Player
Dead_23.text: Who sent you? Was it Cazador?

Dead_2.speaker: Gandrel
Dead_2.text: No... Ulma... leader of my tribe...

Dead_16.speaker: Player
Dead_16.text: What were you going to do to me?

Dead_21.speaker: Player
Dead_21.text: Why did you need me alive? Why not destroy me?

Dead_29.speaker: Gandrel
Dead_29.text: Our children... you know... where they are...

Dead_25.speaker: Player
Dead_25.text: What's your business with this Astarion?

Dead_26.speaker: Gandrel
Dead_26.text: Our children... he knows... where they are...

Dead_31.speaker: Player
Dead_31.text: What brought you to this place?

Dead_3.speaker: Gandrel
Dead_3.text: Dread... creature... but not the one... I hunt...

Dead_10.speaker: Player
Dead_10.text: Do you have anything of value?

Dead_4.speaker: Narrator
Dead_4.text: *The spell's power wanes. You can ask no more questions.*

Dead_15.speaker: Narrator
Dead_15.text: *The corpse seems willing to speak - but not to its killer.*

Dead_22.speaker: Narrator
Dead_22.text: *The corpse does not stir. It will answer no more questions.*

108.speaker: Player
108.text: The thing you hunt - it's my companion, Astarion. I didn't know what he was.

117.speaker: Player
117.text: Astarion's the monster you seek. I wanted to protect him before.

104.speaker: Gandrel
104.text: Go ahead. The lady of the house awaits.

170.speaker: Gandrel
170.text: You've tracked me down again, my friend. Would that I had as much luck with the beast I'm hunting.

152.speaker: Player
152.text: What'll you do when you find the vampire? Kill him?

150.speaker: Gandrel
150.text: Not this time. My orders are to capture him.

143.speaker: Astarion
143.text: Oh? And bring him where, exactly?

15.speaker: Gandrel
15.text: Baldur's Gate. My people wait for me there.

173.speaker: Player
173.text: I'm here to help. This is Astarion - the vampire you're hunting.

174.speaker: Gandrel
174.context: NodeContext: Realises his vampire pray is standing in front of him, in the sun.

166.speaker: Astarion
166.text: You idiot. What have you done?

114.speaker: Player
114.text: I've delivered a monster to a monster hunter.

21.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gur Hunter knocks Astarion out while he's still focused on the player. The vampire collapses to the ground.

16.speaker: Gandrel
16.context: CinematicNodeContext: Standing over the unconcious body of Astarion.

43.speaker: Gandrel
43.text: I thank you for your help. My people work to rid this world of evil - you are a friend to our cause.

42.speaker: Gandrel
42.text: It's amazing you survived, travelling with a beast like that.

189.speaker: Gandrel
189.text: I have a cage ready nearby - it will hold him when he wakes.
189.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hunter pick up the unconcious Astarion, slinging him over his shoulder.NodeContext: Leans down to pick up the unconcious Astarion, slinging him over your shoulder.

109.speaker: Gandrel
109.text: Thank you for this. And for cleansing this swamp of the hag. You have done good here today. Safe travels.
109.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gur Hunter walks away, carrying an unconcious Astarion. He needs to disappear from view before exiting the dialog.NodeContext: While carrying an unconcious body. 'Thank you' line spoken while looking at the player, then you turn and start walking away before calling back the second line.

192.speaker: Gandrel
192.text: I would have made a deal with the hag to find this. I'm very glad that I did not. Thank you and safe travels.
192.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gur Hunter walks away, carrying an unconcious Astarion. He needs to disappear from view before exiting the dialog.NodeContext: While carrying an unconcious body. 'Thank you' line spoken while looking at the player, then you turn and start walking away before calling back the second line.

64.speaker: Gandrel
64.text: I'll return him to my tribe, as ordered. Whatever fate awaits him there, I'm sure it is deserved.

180.speaker: Player
180.text: Take the spawn, just leave his stuff with me.

149.speaker: Gandrel
149.text: It's yours. This is the only prize I need.

146.speaker: Player
146.text: Relax, he's not taking you anywhere.

48.speaker: Gandrel
48.context: NodeContext: This line leads to combat.

172.speaker: Gandrel
172.text: Moonmaiden's light upon you. And may she spare a little for me, too.
172.context: NodeContext: Bracing himself for a task he's not looking forward to - he's about to go in and bargain with a fey creature. More apprehension and reluctant necessity than fear.

188.speaker: Gandrel
188.text: If you'll forgive me, my friend - you have the stink of fey about you.
188.context: NodeContext: Sniffing and commenting on the smell, at pains not to be impolite

186.speaker: Gandrel
186.text: You met with this Auntie Ethel, I take it. But did you pay her price?

158.speaker: Player
158.text: The only price paid was hers. She's dead.

138.speaker: Player
138.text: Price? She was lucky to keep her life.

14.speaker: Player
14.text: She made me an offer - but I refused.

148.speaker: Gandrel
148.text: Your wisdom does you credit. Mine, I'm afraid, is outweighed by need.

74.speaker: Gandrel
74.text: The thing I hunt has eluded me too long. The hag can have what she wants, so long as she helps me find him first.

12.speaker: Gandrel
12.text: I bid you fair fortune on the road. Though you seem the type to make your own.

169.speaker: Gandrel
169.text: I won't pry - not when I have need of her myself.

208.speaker: Gandrel
208.text: Ah, a fellow wanderer. Forgive the aroma.
208.context: NodeContext: Friendly - noticing a stranger, wryly apologising for the slight stench

82.speaker: Narrator
82.text: *You catch a waft of something foul - metallic and sickly-sweet.*

96.speaker: Gandrel
96.text: Powdered iron-vine. Most monsters will think twice before making a meal of me.
96.context: NodeContext: Explaining the smell in the air - he's taken a foul substance designed to ward off monsters

151.speaker: Gandrel
151.text: An old hunter's trick - if you can't mask your scent, spoil it.
151.context: NodeContext: Friendly, unassuming, as if what he's saying is perfectly conventional

11.speaker: Gandrel
11.text: Today? The same as you - a humble supplicant, come to bargain with the lady of this house.

88.speaker: Player
88.text: I prefer a weapon to a stench, thanks.

130.speaker: Gandrel
130.text: Sharp steel is not proof against all the monsters of this world, my friend.

131.speaker: Gandrel
131.text: A sharp wit will serve you better, if you're to bargain with the lady of this house.

123.speaker: Gandrel
123.text: Though... perhaps I speak too swiftly. You have an odour of your own.
123.context: NodeContext: Stopping, sniffing the air, look at us more closely

159.speaker: Gandrel
159.text: The stench of fey blood. You've already met the hag, then?

86.speaker: Player
86.text: I have. She didn't survive the encounter.

147.speaker: Gandrel
147.text: Truly? I won't mourn her passing, though I hoped she would help me on my hunt.
147.context: NodeContext: Faintly surprised - glad to hear this, though it sets his plans back a bit

160.speaker: Gandrel
160.text: I can wait. You, on the other hand, should already be running. Her coven will hear of this.

50.speaker: Gandrel
50.text: They'll stop plotting to kill one another just long enough to focus all that energy on you, instead.
50.context: NodeContext: Wryly amused at the pettiness of powerful beings

119.speaker: Gandrel
119.text: Courage has played its part in this story, my friend. Caution will see you live to tell it.
119.context: NodeContext: Accepting our tough talk, but advising that we might be biting off more than we can chew

33.speaker: Gandrel
33.text: Selûne's light go with you. I fear you will need it to face what is coming.
33.context: NodeContext: Genuinely wishing us well with a tough trial ahead - ominous warning. (Seh-LOON-ay)

58.speaker: Player
58.text: I did - but I let her keep her life.

115.speaker: Gandrel
115.text: Honourable, but unwise. Her kind don't share your forgiving nature.

206.speaker: Gandrel
206.text: I hoped she might help me on my hunt - but I have no desire to be the first face she sees after yours.
206.context: NodeContext: Knows what's good for him

122.speaker: Gandrel
122.text: I'll have to find my quarry by more traditional means. But, one hunter to another - well done.
122.context: NodeContext: Resolving himself to taking the harder road, but never despairing - the congratulating you on your kill

118.speaker: Gandrel
118.text: Little enough - I hoped she might help me on my hunt, but I suppose she's... indisposed.
118.context: NodeContext: Unfazed by our hostility to his questions - explaning that he was hoping to speak to someone he suspects we've just killed.

110.speaker: Gandrel
110.text: That is why you come to her lair, I take it? To bargain?
110.context: NodeContext: Gently prodding for our story

76.speaker: Player
76.text: Are you talking about Auntie Ethel?

107.speaker: Gandrel
107.text: A gentle name. But I speak of her nature.

24.speaker: Gandrel
24.text: A more innocent name than some I could call her. But it is what she is that ought to concern you.

167.speaker: Gandrel
167.text: Because this is her domain. If you are here, it is because it suits her.
167.context: NodeContext: Stating the facts as they are - the hag dwarfs his power, and he accepts that and walks in anyway

175.speaker: Player
175.text: It's a teahouse - hardly a lair.

141.speaker: Gandrel
141.text: A charming sight, to be sure. But the prettiest web still has a spider sitting at its centre.
141.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of sign for tea-house here if possible.

66.speaker: Player
66.text: Not at all. I was invited for tea.

6.speaker: Gandrel
6.text: Of course - as the spider invites the fly. You need something, I expect. And she sensed it.
6.context: NodeContext: Not mocking, just gently brushing away the notion that we're in control of our situation

102.speaker: Gandrel
102.text: Her kind have hidden among us since the first darkness - and their knowledge is matched only by their spite.
102.context: NodeContext: Growing slightly grave - telling us of a great evil thing that is not to be underestimated

13.speaker: Gandrel
13.text: Know how to ask, and they'll share that knowledge. If you're fool enough to pay their price.
13.context: NodeContext: Telling us the risk might be worth the reward - but is is a great risk

209.speaker: Gandrel
209.text: A powerful friend. A terrible foe. That, I cannot decide for you.

127.speaker: Gandrel
127.text: For my part - I need her knowledge. The thing I hunt has gone to ground.

116.speaker: Gandrel
116.text: Of course. I'm a hunter who lost his prey, and here I am seeking help from something worse.
116.context: NodeContext: Amused and absolutely accepting of his own foolishness

3.speaker: Gandrel
3.text: But she thrives on suffering. Once she hears what awaits my quarry when I catch him, she will help.

125.speaker: Gandrel
125.text: Truth is like a blade, my friend. We can arm ourselves with it.
125.context: NodeContext: Grave - we're asking a question he believes we don't really want the answer to

72.speaker: Gandrel
72.text: Or just as easily find it pressed against our throat. I would not put you in danger.
72.context: NodeContext: Grave - we're asking a question he believes we don't really want the answer to. The warning is for our own good, not a threat

35.speaker: Player
35.text: There's enough deception in this place - don't add to it.

177.speaker: Gandrel
177.text: It is not everyone who can see past her parlour tricks. As you wish - the truth is not mine to keep.
177.context: NodeContext: Impressed at how perceptive we are

27.speaker: Player
27.text: Maybe I can help with your hunt.

83.speaker: Gandrel
83.text: No. This duty is mine alone. But for such an offer, an answer at least is owed.

87.speaker: Gandrel
87.text: A kind offer - but to accept it would be no kindness at all, I assure you.

54.speaker: Gandrel
54.text: You've done your part in dealing with the hag. Now, my own hunt must continue.

163.speaker: Gandrel
163.text: Besides - first I must survive what waits in that house. One terror at a time, hm?
163.context: NodeContext: Terrified of ethel but holding it together

80.speaker: Player
80.text: Come now - I've almost certainly killed worse.

37.speaker: Gandrel
37.text: I would not be so sure. But I won't keep the truth from you.

112.speaker: Gandrel
112.text: I hunt a vampire spawn called Astarion. I'm bound to bring him back to Baldur's Gate - alive.

203.speaker: Gandrel
203.text: Though I cannot swear to his condition once my tribe are done with him. Is he known to you?

120.speaker: Player
120.text: I know Astarion - he's no vampire.

46.speaker: Gandrel
46.text: So you have met him. His kind have charm beyond our mortal means to resist.
46.context: NodeContext: Confirming his suspicions that we know the man he seeks

57.speaker: Gandrel
57.text: But you're right - he's no true vampire. Not yet. I don't suppose you'll tell me where he is?

79.speaker: Player
79.text: Tell him how to find your camp.

36.speaker: Gandrel
36.text: A wise decision. I will do my work - and for what it is worth, I will take no pleasure in it.
36.context: NodeContext: Comforting us after we've given up our friend, and assuring us there'll be no suffering.

164.speaker: Gandrel
164.text: I bid you good fortune with the lady of the house.

84.speaker: Player
84.text: I honestly don't know where he is.

81.speaker: Gandrel
81.text: ...As you say. Then I must redouble my efforts, and pray my delay costs no more lives.
81.context: NodeContext: Not fully believing us, but not pressing the issue.

171.speaker: Player
171.text: I'm not going to help you find him. Back off.

191.speaker: Gandrel
191.text: Astarion has quite the friend in you. I'll make sure he knows that, at the end.
191.context: NodeContext: Seeing through our intimidation, but respecting our intentions - and a little sad at what he has to do. (NOTE - he doesn't attack us, but is reaffirming that he will find Astarion one way or another)

98.speaker: Player
98.text: We've met - he's not the type to come quietly.

124.speaker: Gandrel
124.text: You do know him? I don't suppose you'll tell me where he is?

2.speaker: Gandrel
2.text: Ah, well. If you had, I could not fault you for lying - his kind have charm beyond our mortal means to resist.

145.speaker: Gandrel
145.text: Or so I'm told. With the hag gone, I shall have to wait a while longer to see for myself.

56.speaker: Gandrel
56.text: But best to take one terror at a time, hm? I've used enough of your time - the lady awaits.

97.speaker: Player
97.text: You can give up your hunt. Astarion's under my protection.

198.speaker: Gandrel
198.text: ...I see. Your loyalty is admirable but misplaced. His kind have charm beyond our mortal means to resist.
198.context: NodeContext: Digesting this information, taking us seriously

71.speaker: Gandrel
71.text: I can show you who he truly is - if you will just tell me where to find him.

45.speaker: Player
45.text: You're wasting your time. Astarion's been dealt with.

132.speaker: Gandrel
132.text: You know him? Not too well, I think, if you believe he is so easily slain. He could be stalking your camp at this very moment.

90.speaker: Gandrel
90.text: Perhaps you could tell me where to look, and I could ensure peace of mind for us both?

182.speaker: Player
182.text: What does your tribe want with a creature like that?

100.speaker: Gandrel
100.text: My people were recently attacked in the night - our camp set upon by a band of vampire spawn.

195.speaker: Gandrel
195.text: In the chaos of battle, one of them stole away with our children. We have been searching for them ever since.

103.speaker: Gandrel
103.text: We believe this Astarion knows exactly what happened that night, and where to find our little ones.

39.speaker: Gandrel
39.text: If captured, my people will make him talk. So I ask again: is he known to you?

154.speaker: Gandrel
154.text: Without doubt. But this is a personal quarry - one hunter to another, I'm sure you understand.

32.speaker: Player
32.text: Your coyness is getting boring. Tell me.

128.speaker: Gandrel
128.text: You take insult where none is intended, my friend. But fine - I won't add to it.
128.context: NodeContext: Mild, amused but unfazed by our aggression - but giving us our way

9.speaker: Gandrel
9.text: I do not think that I will.
9.context: NodeContext: Not angry, but utterly unintimidated by us

78.speaker: Gandrel
78.text: You made a fine kill today, my friend - content yourself with that.
78.context: NodeContext: This is a threat, but given in the guise of friendly advice. He thinks we'd be wiser not to push any further.

157.speaker: Gandrel
157.text: Questions are free - answers are not. Better to learn that before you meet the lady of the house.

59.speaker: Player
59.text: I like danger. The truth - now.

106.speaker: Gandrel
106.text: Perhaps I was... hasty with my words.

41.speaker: Gandrel
41.text: Strong words may frighten others, my friend, but it takes much more to scare those in my line of work.

140.speaker: Player
140.text: Never mind. I already regret asking.

135.speaker: Gandrel
135.text: Questions should never bring you regret, my friend. Answers are another matter.
135.context: NodeContext: Softening the blow of his refusal to answer our questions

69.speaker: Player
69.text: Any advice on how to deal with her?

153.speaker: Gandrel
153.text: Scream. Turn. Run the other way - that's what I'd like to say.

197.speaker: Gandrel
197.text: But bad as she is, I'm betting whatever drove you to her door is worse.

23.speaker: Gandrel
23.text: So instead: know you're outmatched. Know what you're willing to give. And mind your manners.

61.speaker: Player
61.text: I'd advise against helping such a creature thrive. What quarry could be worth that price?

38.speaker: Gandrel
38.text: Ah - so you did. I thought you were just squinting from the stink.
38.context: NodeContext: Getting a better look at one of your eyes, which is glowing with a baleful light after you traded it to a hag.

201.speaker: Gandrel
201.text: But, one fool to another, I can't say I judge you. The thing I hunt has slipped away from me.
201.context: NodeContext: Shrugging - he can't judge us for a foolish decision when he's here to make the same mistake

62.speaker: Gandrel
62.text: If she can tell me how to flush him out, I'll pay whatever price she asks.

133.speaker: Player
133.text: Speak for yourself - I got what I wanted.

53.speaker: Gandrel
53.text: So said the fish 'round the hook in its mouth.

68.speaker: Gandrel
68.text: Whatever's easiest to lose and hardest to do without.

179.speaker: Gandrel
179.text: But the thing I hunt has gone to ground. If she can tell me how to draw him out, I'll pay whatever she asks.

202.speaker: Player
202.text: I know Ethel - that sounds nothing like her.

99.speaker: Gandrel
99.text: I hope this Ethel is waiting for you when you walk through that door. But I suspect you'll find something else.
99.context: NodeContext: Earnest, but knows things are not as we wish them to be

161.speaker: Player
161.text: I think you're mistaken - this place looks innocent enough.

212.speaker: Gandrel
212.text: That would be nice. I'd welcome a proper cup of tea.

28.speaker: Gandrel
28.text: But I'm not wrong. Take her lightly, and she'll serve up your eyes for appetisers.

29.speaker: Gandrel
29.text: I'll eat them, too. I need her knowledge - the thing I hunt has gone to ground.
29.context: NodeContext: Only faintly apologetic - he wishes us no harm, but he needs the hag and her information

134.speaker: Player
134.text: Not much of a bargain. She made an offer - I refused.

8.speaker: Gandrel
8.text: Truly? Then you know what she is - what she can do.

7.speaker: Gandrel
7.text: You're wise to walk away. But I cannot - the thing I hunt has gone to ground.
7.context: NodeContext: Acknowledging that we have more willpower than him - he knows he shouldn't deal with a hag, but also knows he has to

187.speaker: Player
187.text: My business here is my own.

137.speaker: Gandrel
137.text: As you like. But you needn't be coy - whatever's worth knowing, rest assured she already knows it.
137.context: NodeContext: Nodding, not fazed by our secrecy though he thinks it unnecessary

70.speaker: Player
70.text: You're a monster hunter? Not what I imagined.

178.speaker: Gandrel
178.text: Hah. Perhaps that is why I have survived so long where more fearsome peers have not.
178.context: NodeContext: Serene, absolutely unoffended by us basically saying he doesn't look too tough

30.speaker: Gandrel
30.text: You would be wise to look past the seeming of things, if you intend to bargain with the lady of this house.

31.speaker: Player
31.text: We share a profession, it seems. I'm Wyll - better known as the Blade of Frontiers.

210.speaker: Gandrel
210.text: Ah, the Blade of Frontiers! You wield that reputation as deftly as a blade itself.

176.speaker: Gandrel
176.text: Your name should serve you well when you meet with the lady of this house.

91.speaker: Player
91.text: Whatever you're hunting, your stench alone will kill it.

156.speaker: Gandrel
156.text: Hah! A quick wit is rare indeed. Good manners, however, all beings can aspire to.
156.context: NodeContext: We've just insulted him and he's absolutely unfazed. Second line is simply polite advice.

77.speaker: Gandrel
77.text: I suggest you find yours before dealing with the lady of this house.
77.context: NodeContext: Advising with only a slight hint of admonishment
